page.title: 07MORRIS DANCING IN ABINGDON
page.content: Morris Dancing started in Abingdon in about 1560 in The St. Helen's Street area. Abingdon Morris Dancers won the head of an ox in 1700 from another team of dancers from the Vineyard area of the town, when a fight developed after a dancing competition. Abingdon Morris Dancers could be the oldest out of about 300-400 groups in England. Each year a new Mayor of Ock Street is elected. He is taken up and down Ock Street in a chair. In his hand he would have a cup of beer which all the Morris Men drink out of. The cup is 300 years old and it is called the Ock Street Mace, it is made of real silver. The Mayor also carries a sword that is 50 years old. Mr. Argyle is the Mayor of Ock Street and he says who the leader of the Morris Men will be. Only Ock Street residents are allowed to vote.By Matthew Spraggs(11).
